title: `minContains: 0` without `maxContains` never fails
description: When `minContains` is 0 and `maxContains` is absent, the schema accepts any number of matching elements. Specify `maxContains` to make the constraint meaningful.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Wrong: minContains 0 with no maxContains
comprehensiveExamples.description: Without an upper bound, minContains:0 places no restriction.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Right: minContains with explicit cap
comprehensiveExamples.description: Adding maxContains makes the constraint meaningful.

message: Add an upper bound with `maxContains` or remove `minContains: 0`.
